author: NoraCodes
body:
The Stop-Computer cmdlet is missing:

```
PS /home/leo> Stop-Computer                                                    
Stop-Computer : The term 'Stop-Computer' is not recognized as the name of a 
cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program. Check the spelling of the 
name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try 
again.
At line:1 char:1
+ Stop-Computer
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (Stop-Computer:String) [], Comm 
   andNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CommandNotFoundException
```

Would it be possible to either add it in, or document that it is not available?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Please include `$PSVersionTable` information as requested by the template next time, please.  Based on your prompt, it looks like you're on Linux.  The *-Computer cmdlets depend on WMI so they don't work outside of Windows currently.  It would be great if the community could port them to non-Windows.

comments.author: NoraCodes
comments.body:
Ah, sorry; I missed that was suppose to be included. My version is 

```
Name                           Value                                          
----                           -----                                          
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta                                     
PSEdition                      Core                                           
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.7                                  
OS                             Linux 4.10.0-38-generic #42-Ubuntu SMP Tue O...
Platform                       Unix                                           
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                        
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                            
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                        
WSManStackVersion              3.0  
```

Is there documentation somewhere that WMI cmdlets aren't available off of Windows? If not, could that be added? I'm not really familiar with the Windows environment, and it's fairly counterintuitive as to where various cmdlets come from (since the documentation I've found online doesn't mention it).

Anyway, thanks for the info! I'll fall back to using SMB or something.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Documentation is currently missing, something we'll need to add to the release notes.  The best resource currently is probably this test file: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/2be13a623eae2583604ab51449eefc10a8fd9c12/test/powershell/engine/Basic/DefaultCommands.Tests.ps1

comments.author: scoobert
comments.body: Stop-Computer only works locally if running PowerShell (7.1.1) on MacOS. There is no recognized "-ComputerName" flag. Is this intended or is it still a missing feature?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: -ComputerName uses WMI/WSMan.  So, yes this is intended.  I think you are asking for a new feature for this to support -HostName to run this over SSH remoting?

comments.author: scoobert
comments.body: That makes a lot of sense actually, thank you for that clarification. I wasn't _originally_ asking for that to be a feature, but it does sound like a great idea!

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: If that is what you want, Please file a feature request.
